title: Ticket #5671: Linux kernel tuning script should set root_maxkeys and root_maxbytes
description:
As described in incident #5657, the condor_master may EXCEPT upon startup if the root user is unable to allocate a new linux kernel session keyring.

The problem is the quota for kernel keys is very very small in RHEL 6.0. It was increased by default in RHEL 6.3 from 200 to 1M.

To help prevent incident #5657 from re-occurring upon installation on RHEL 6.0, 6.1, or 6.2, propose that the HTCondor linux tuning script set the key quotas to the same as the defaults in RHEL 6.3. Also suggest that the error message printed by the condor_master be more helpful in the event it cannot allocate a new keyring due to kernel quotas.
